# Draft:David Lewis Stewart Parry

----
David Lewis Stewart Parry (born 1980) is a Welsh independent researcher and author.
He is best known for formulating the Universal Heartbeat Theory (UHT) and Parry Tensional Phase Collapse (PTPC)> — a framework that describes the universe not as a single event, but as a "Rhythm: a heartbeat that expands, contracts, and renews".
Early life and direction
David Parry was born in Wrexham , Wales in the UK but moved to SouthWales at a very early age with his parents (Lewis and Karen) and sister (Julia), David has a younger sister ( Caroline ) and a Daughter ( Mischa). He  began his professional life outside of academic science. After getting divorced he moved to china where he started to catalog his research into cosmology and later turned to theoretical research, developing his ideas independently, through a combination of cosmology, thermodynamics, and information theory.
His writing style blends mathematics with narrative, often describing physical law through rhythm, symmetry, and curvature.
Research and ideas
The Parry Cosmology Framework consolidates several connected theories. Those theories consist of Cosmology, Thermodynamics, 4th Dimensional Law,   :
The Universal Heartbeat Theory, The Parry Tensional Phase Collapse, and The Energy Feedback Controller (PEFC)
* The Universal Heartbeat: Entropy, Symmetry, and the Rhythm of Cosmic Rebirth (2025)
* The Fourth-Dimensional Curvature Law (2025, ResearchGate)
Selected archives:
* [https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.16948782 Parry Cosmology: Thermodynamic Curvature and PTPC Methods]
* [https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.17274926 A Parameter–Minimal Fix for the Bounce Trigger]
* [https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.17339451 The Fourth-Dimensional Curvature Law]
Applications
David Parry has also explored how theoretical curvature feedback appears in computation. Using an algorithm that is based on the PTPC,
He has developed prototype controllers that monitor energy flow in GPUs and CPUs, modeling the thermodynamic “heartbeat” of active systems, showing the heavier the load, the greater the control mimicking the results found with entropy based PTPC bounce.
These experiments among others are all documented in his technical papers and simulation datasets. all are freely available to check , test and expand on.
Reception
As of 2025, David Parry’s cosmological framework remains independent without institutional funding and independently published and has not undergone formal peer review as of yet.
there is interest within open-access research communities for its mathematical coherence and reproducible simulation codes.
